dt: {bc}any of various usually small energetic dogs originally used by hunters to dig for small game and engage the quarry underground or drive it out

et: Middle English {it}terryer, terrer{/it}, from Anglo-French ({it}chen{/it}) {it}terrer{/it}, literally, earth dog, from {it}terre{/it} earth, from Latin {it}terra{/it}
shortdef: any of various usually small energetic dogs originally used by hunters to dig for small game and engage the quarry underground or drive it out

dt: {bc}any of a breed of large terriers with a hard, wiry, black-and-tan coat

et: {it}Airedale{/it}, valley of the Aire River, England
shortdef: any of a breed of large terriers with a hard, wiry, black-and-tan coat —called also Airedale

dt: {bc}any of a breed of muscular, agile dogs that have a short, smooth coat, were developed to combine the traits of terriers and bulldogs, have extremely powerful jaws and great strength and tenacity, and that were originally bred for dog fighting

shortdef: any of a breed of muscular, agile dogs that have a short, smooth coat, were developed to combine the traits of terriers and bulldogs, have extremely powerful jaws and great strength and tenacity, and that were originally bred for dog fighting —called also pit bull terrier

dt: {bc}any of a breed of strong stocky dogs that are of similar ancestry to but are larger and heavier than the related American pit bull terrier and Staffordshire bull terrier

shortdef: any of a breed of strong stocky dogs that are of similar ancestry to but are larger and heavier than the related American pit bull terrier and Staffordshire bull terrier

dt: {bc}any of a breed of small rather short-legged wirehaired terriers of Australian origin usually having a tan and blue or sandy coat

shortdef: any of a breed of small rather short-legged wirehaired terriers of Australian origin usually having a tan and blue or sandy coat

dt: {bc}a swift lightly built terrier of English origin with a long narrow head, arched back, and usually curly coat

shortdef: a swift lightly built terrier of English origin with a long narrow head, arched back, and usually curly coat —called also Bedlington

dt: {bc}any of a breed of small terriers of British origin having a harsh dense coat and close undercoat

shortdef: any of a breed of small terriers of British origin having a harsh dense coat and close undercoat

dt: {bc}any of a breed of small smooth-coated terriers originating as a cross of the bulldog and bull terrier and being brindled or black with white markings

shortdef: any of a breed of small smooth-coated terriers originating as a cross of the bulldog and bull terrier and being brindled or black with white markings —called also Boston bull

dt: {bc}any of a breed of small compactly built hard-coated terriers of Scottish origin

et: from its use in hunting among cairns
shortdef: any of a breed of small compactly built hard-coated terriers of Scottish origin

dt: {bc}any of a breed of terriers characterized by short legs, a long body, pendulous ears, a rough coat, and a full silky topknot

et: {it}Dandie Dinmont{/it}, character owning six such dogs in the novel {it}Guy Mannering{/it} by Sir Walter Scott
shortdef: any of a breed of terriers characterized by short legs, a long body, pendulous ears, a rough coat, and a full silky topknot
